verses.verse: And so it came about on the second Sabbath after the first that he went through the grain fields, and his disciples plucked the grain heads and ate after rubbing them in their hands.
Certain of the Pharisees said to them, "Why are you doing what is unlawful to do on the Sabbath?"
Jesus answering them said, "Haven't you read as much as this what David did when he was hungry and those who were with him?
"How he went into the house of God, took and ate the showbread, and also gave to those who were with him, which is unlawful to eat except for only the priests?"
He also said to them, "The Son of Man is Lord even of the Sabbath."
Then it also came to pass on another Sabbath, that he entered into the synagogue and taught. A man whose right hand was withered was there.
The Scribes and Pharisees closely watched him, whether he would heal on the Sabbath, so they could find a criminal charge against him.
But he knew their thoughts and said to the man who had the withered hand, "Get up, and stand in the midst." Then he got up and stood in the midst.
Then Jesus said to them, "I will ask you one thing; is it lawful on Sabbath days to do good or evil, to save life or destroy it?"
And looking around on all of them, he said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." He did so, and his hand was restored, healthy as the other.
Then they were filled with rage, and talked it over with one another as what to do with Jesus.
And so in those days, he went out to a mountain to pray, continuing all night in prayer to God.
When it was day, he called his disciples and from them he chose twelve whom he also called apostles.
Simon (whom he also called Peter), Andrew, his brother, James, John, Philip, and Bartholomew,
Matthew, Thomas, James the son of Alphaeus, and Simon called Zelotes,
Judas, James' [brother], and Judas Iscariot, who also was the traitor.

He came down with them and stood in the plain, and the group of his disciples along with a great crowd of people from all of Judea, Jerusalem, and from the sea coast of Tyre and Sidon came to hear him and to be healed of their diseases.
Those who were vexed with unclean spirits were healed.
The whole multitude sought to touch him, for miraculous power went out of him and healed all.
He lifted up his eyes on his disciples and said, "Blessed are you who are poor, for yours is the Kingdom of God.
"Blessed are you who hunger now, for you will be filled. Blessed are you who weep now, for you will laugh.
"Blessed are you, when men will hate you and when they will separate you and will reproach you and throw your name out as evil, for the Son of Man's sake.
"Rejoice in that day and jump for joy, for, behold, your reward is great in heaven [and] in the same way their fathers did to the prophets.
"But woe to you who are rich, for you have received your comfort.
"Woe to you who are rich, for you will hunger. Woe to you who laugh now, for you will mourn and weep.
"Woe to you when everyone speaks well of you, for so their fathers did to the false prophets.
"But I tell you, who hear, love your enemies; do good to those who hate you.
"Bless those who curse you, and pray for those who spitefully use you.
"And to the one who smacks you on the cheek, even offer the other, and to the one who takes away your cloak, don't stop [him from taking your] inner garment, too.
"Give to every one who asks you, and of him who carries off your goods, don't ask for them back.
"As you want people to treat you, so you do to them in the same way.
"For if you love those who love you, what benefit is that, for even sinners love those who love them.
"If you do good to those who do good to you, what benefit is that, for even sinners also do the same.
"If you lend [to those] from whom you hope to get paid back, what benefit is that, for even sinners lend to sinners to get paid back the same.
"But if you love your enemies, do good, and lend (expecting nothing back), your reward will be great and you will be the children of the Highest, for he is kind to the unthankful and the evil.
"Therefore be merciful just like your Father also is merciful.
"Don't judge, and you won't be judged. Don't condemn, and you will not be condemned. Forgive, and you will be forgiven.

"Give, and it will be given to you. Good measure pressed down, shaken together, and running over will people give to the fold of your robe [into your lap--edit]. For with the same measure that you measure out, the same will be measured out to you."
Then he told a parable to them, "Can the blind lead the blind? Won't they both fall into the ditch?
"The disciple is not above his master, but everyone, who is what he should be, will be like his master.
"Why are you staring at the speck that is in your brother's eye, but can't perceive the chunk of wood that is in your own eye?

"Or how can you say to your brother, «Brother, let me pull out that speck that is in your eye,' when you, yourself, aren't looking at that chunk of wood that is in your own eye? You hypocrite, first throw out that chunk of wood out of your own eye, and then you will clearly see to pull out that speck that is in your brother's eye.
"For a good tree doesn't bring forth worthless fruit, nor does a worthless tree bring forth high-quality fruit.
"For every tree is known by its own fruit, for from thorns men don't gather figs or from a bramble bush gather grapes.

"A good man out of the good treasure of his heart brings forth what which is good, and an evil man out of the evil treasure of his heart brings forth that which is evil, for the mouth speaks from the abundance in the heart.
"Why do you call be, «Lord, Lord,» and don't do the things which I ask?
"Whosoever comes to me, hears my sayings, and does them, I'll show you what he is like.
"He is like a man who built a house, dug deep, and laid the foundation on a rock. When the flood arose, the stream beat vehemently on that house but couldn't shake it, for it was founded on a rock.

"But he who hears and doesn't do it, is like a man who without a foundation built a house on the earth. The stream beat vehemently against it, and it immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great."
